1.text: Benjamin became the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, and Aharah the third,

2.text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.

3.text: Bela had sons: Addar, and Gera, and Abihud,

4.text: and Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,

5.text: and Gera, and Shephuphan, and Huram.

6.text: These are the sons of Ehud: these are the heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Geba, and they carried them captive to Manahath:

7.text: and Naaman, and Ahijah, and Gera, he carried them captive: and he became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.

8.text: Shaharaim became the father of children in the field of Moab, after he had sent them away; Hushim and Baara were his wives.

9.text: He became the father of Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcam,

10.text: and Jeuz, and Shachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of fathers’ households.

11.text: Of Hushim he became the father of Abitub and Elpaal.

12.text: The sons of Elpaal: Eber, and Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod, with its towns;

13.text: and Beriah, and Shema, who were heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who put to flight the inhabitants of Gath;

15.text: and Zebadiah, and Arad, and Eder,

16.text: and Michael, and Ishpah, and Joha, the sons of Beriah,

17.text: and Zebadiah, and Meshullam, and Hizki, and Heber,

18.text: and Ishmerai, and Izliah, and Jobab, the sons of Elpaal,

19.text: and Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,

20.text: and Elienai, and Zillethai, and Eliel,

21.text: and Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimei,

22.text: and Ishpan, and Eber, and Eliel,

23.text: and Abdon, and Zichri, and Hanan,

24.text: and Hananiah, and Elam, and Anthothijah,

25.text: and Iphdeiah, and Penuel, the sons of Shashak,

26.text: and Shamsherai, and Shehariah, and Athaliah,

27.text: and Jaareshiah, and Elijah, and Zichri, the sons of Jeroham.

28.text: These were heads of fathers’ households throughout their generations, chief men: these lived in Jerusalem.

29.text: In Gibeon there lived the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Maacah;

30.text: and his firstborn son Abdon, and Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Nadab,

31.text: and Gedor, and Ahio, and Zecher.

32.text: Mikloth became the father of Shimeah. They also lived with their brothers in Jerusalem, over against their brothers.

33.text: Ner became the father of Kish; and Kish became the father of Saul; and Saul became the father of Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

34.text: The son of Jonathan was Merib Baal; and Merib Baal became the father of Micah.

35.text: The sons of Micah: Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.

36.text: Ahaz became the father of Jehoaddah; and Jehoaddah became the father of Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri became the father of Moza.

37.text: Moza became the father of Binea; Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.

38.text: Azel had six sons, whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.

39.text: The sons of Eshek his brother: Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.

40.text: The sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and had many sons, and sons’ sons, one hundred fifty. All these were of the sons of Benjamin.
